lexUnit.name: conceal.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: prevent from being perceptually accessible

sentence.text: Most fishkeepers try to recreate a natural-looking underwater scene in their community tanks , and also to conceal the equipment , increasing the natural effect .
He pointed out that the prisoner did not deny that he had killed his wife , but it was a spur-of-the-moment loss of temper , and that his client had panicked and tried to conceal the body .
Instead , I find myself wondering what Tom Fairfax was concealing behind the seal face and marine eyebrows .
Lorton pulled back so that the concrete pillar concealed him completely .
Almost without thinking , she concealed her emotion with anger and action as she sprang to her feet and tore the emeralds from her ears .
He tried to conceal his astonishment but Sir Thomas was almost laughing at him .
The vendor may have deliberately concealed the defect and may have acted fraudulently .
Fearing that Morris had stopped to watch him yawning , he would at once return to his work , and try to conceal his yawns behind his hand .
True , he concealed his second and third chins beneath a grey-brown beard that only got an efficient trimming at the hands of Peccable 's eldest daughter Hoi-Polloi .
During the hearings , officials from the CIA apparently admitted having concealed evidence from Judge Shoob , but claimed that they had been pressurized into doing so by the Justice Department .
Jones was modest about her poetry and concealed it from her friends in Oxford .
At times Anne felt sure that he was attracted to her , but if so why did he never ask to meet her , and why did he conceal these chance meetings from his family ?
Bridget concealed her pregnancy from everybody until she was about four months when she told her boyfriend , who was not the baby 's father .
I suspected this fool was so desperate for money that he 'd concealed the bumps and scratches on the disc with black shoe polish , so I was examining its surface with a magnifying glass .
If that were true , she was concealing her grief at his death with remarkable stoicism .
She managed to conceal the physical revulsion she always felt from close contact with this man .
Being lazy myself I sometimes conceal them in grass , water or strategic pebbles -- happily often observed like that in any case .
The immaculate officer stepped gingerly aboard Sinar Surya and failed to conceal his astonishment at our living conditions .
Every gesture was judged and measured , while they concealed their interest behind beard-scratching , nose-stroking , brow-rubbing hands .
Perhaps you should conceal some small flowerpots under the wood .
